verses.roman:
janmany anantare rājan
sarva-bhūta-suhṛttamaḥ
bhūtvā dvija-varas tvaṁ vai
mām upaiṣyasi kevalam

synonyms: janmani—in the birth; anantare—immediately following; rājan—O King; sarva—of all; bhūta—living beings; suhṛt-tamaḥ—a supreme well-wisher; bhūtvā—becoming; dvija-varaḥ—an excellent brāhmaṇa; tvam—you; vai—indeed; mam—to Me; upaiṣyasi—will come; kevalam—exclusively.
translation: O King, in your very next life you will become an excellent brāhmaṇa, the greatest well-wisher of all creatures, and certainly come to Me alone.

purport.content: Śrī Kṛṣṇa states in the Bhagavad-gītā , suhṛdaṁ sarva-bhūtānāṁ jñātvā māṁ śāntim ṛcchati: "A person attains peace by understanding Me to be the well-wishing friend of all living beings." Lord Kṛṣṇa and His pure devotees work together to rescue the fallen souls from the ocean of illusion. This is the real purport of the Kṛṣṇa consciousness movement.
